data.sampled:
The given Note Tempo Values take up 8 measures in the given Time Signature of 12/8.

Explanation:
The given Note Tempo Values consist of 8 half notes (or 64 beats per measure) and 4 quarter notes (or 32 beats per measure).

Half Note: 16 beats per measure

Quarter Note: 8 beats per measure

Total number of beats per measure: 40

Division of total beats by the number of bars: 8 measures per bar

Division of 40 beats per measure by the number of bars: 800 beats

12/8 time signature has a common division of 4 into 2, so:

Division of 800 beats by 2: 400

Number of measures: 400

800 divided by 4/2= 200, round up to the nearest whole number, which gives measure count of 400.

picked:
A tempo is a measure of how quickly a piece of music is to be performed. The tempo commonly applies to all the measures. In this case, the given time signature is 8/8, which means that each bar will be played back for the duration of eight measures at a given tempo. In this case, the tempo value for the piece is 16 (half notes * 8 bars). You can find the tempo of a piece by measuring the time signature of the piece and dividing the values. When writing music, keep these rules in mind:
- If your tempo value is the same for all the measures, the bar line will be the dividing factor. 
- In case your tempo value varies for each measure, use the measure line to split them. 
- If you're unsure, you can always ask me! 🤖
